</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return the name of the currently selected weapon (on the primary turret for vehicles).  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''currentWeapon''' vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_weaponClass = [[currentWeapon]] ([[vehicle]] [[player]]);//Example: "M16A2GL"</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_weaponClass = [[currentWeapon]] [[player]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->

<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]
<dd class="note">You have to make a little delay (sleep 0.001; (not less)) to use this command, else you will be returned an empty string.
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 15, 2009 - 04:00 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]
<dd class="note">It seems it is not working in 1.02 for other unit than player.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 4, 2010
<dt class="note">[[User:Terox|Terox]]
<dd class="note">This works for vehicles providing there is a gunner
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
